content.description: Start low with both hands on the wide, slanted sloping edge. Work your way up vertically and to the right, reaching a wide crimp. Top out with a slopey finish on the upper right edge of the boulder. Caution and good protection is necessary, as there is a large tree in front of the climbing face and sharp rocks to the right.
content.location: After arriving in the gravel parking lot/pullover, begin hiking up the trail, on the right of GoForth creek. The Grand Dilemma boulder is the first large and climbable boulder you will see, about 150 ft up the trail and after a small stream crossing. The Grand Dilemma problem is on the vertical face pointed towards the trail head; the other side of the boulder is a slab face covered in graffiti.

content.description:
Heavily forested creekside boulder field. No access fees as it is a roadside pull out.  First Boulders are within 100 feet of parking.

 This area has huge potential and is largely undeveloped.  

 Please be responsible as this lies within the Cherokee National Forest.  Practice Leave No Trace and do not alter the landscape.
